title: UNIVERSAL RULES & PROBLEMS
body:
This post is regarding newer board users if your 4 years in, I suggest you not waste time.

Universal Rule: No calling out others.
This is done WAY too many times by new board users when I started, I made the same mistake, TWICE!
what im saying is that the universal rule should be pinned at the top or something, at least so that newer board users will know, when i scroll down in the PB&M section, i always see posts that call out someone, atleast once or twice.

replies.body: i've seen several people refer to 'universal rules'. i havn't seen the document anywhere. can you link me?

> [{quoted}](name=Aptest,realm=EUW,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=5HvKQ4Fh,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-05-19T15:41:41.242+0000)
>
> i've seen several people refer to 'universal rules'. i havn't seen the document anywhere. can you link me?

In the top left of the subboard navigation is a big bolder Universal Rules link. Look just to the left of the OP paragraph.

Not only are the Universal Rules pinned to the top left of the page near each post and when you're looking at posts, but when you scroll down the respective sub-board, rules are also under there:

http://imgur.com/a/Ast6h
I've pinned it the Player Behavior section for the time being while we look into how we can make it more visible for new players. Thanks for the heads up!
how about when someone breaks the rules for the first time, the warning letter contains the info? so that people wont be me and call out people 2 times.

Were the violations on this account? I looked at your history and it looks like the only removals you've had pertained to incorrect sub-boards rather than naming and shaming. We can  for sure work on refining the messaging around our moderation actions.

my posts contain calling out about people hacking/botting, if you'd like to remove it, sure I don't care, just don't send me a warning letter.
